apiReadKey.title: PurpleAir API read key
apiReadKey.description: Åƒot needed when you want to access your private sensors over the local network. To obtain the API read key, reach out to contact@purpleair.com.

name.title: Name
name.description: This name will be used as the accessory name in HomeKit.

useLocalNetwork.title: Use sensor directly on the local network.
useLocalNetwork.description: If checked, you must provide the local IP address of the sensor. Otherwise, PurpleAir public API will be used for which you must provide the API read key.

sensor.title: Sensor ID
sensor.description: Required. Find the sensor ID by going to PurpleAir's map -> click on a sensor, and look at the URL. It's the number right after 'select='.

localIPAddress.title: Sensor IP/hostname
localIPAddress.description: Local IP/hostname address of the sensor

key.title: Key for private sensors
key.description: Only needed for private sensors. Check the sensor map's URL for the 'key=' string. If you don't have a key, you can leave this field empty and the plugin will try to access the sensor as public. Note: this is different from the API read key.

humidity.title: Report humidity
humidity.description: If checked, the plugin will report humidity as a separate sensor in HomeKit.

temperature.title: Report temperature
temperature.description: If checked, the plugin will report temperature as a separate sensor in HomeKit.

conversion.title: Conversion
conversion.description: Conversions help accomodate different types of pollution with different particle densities. Note: for EPA you need to enable fetching humidity.

averages.title: Reading Averages
averages.description: Note that for sensors accessed via local network, this config is ignored and always uses 2m average.

aqiInsteadOfDensity.title: Report AQI number instead of density (ug/m^3). HomeKit only allows reporting PM2.5 density instead of AQI value, but some prefer to see AQI value instead. If checked, the plugin will use the density field to report the AQI value.

verboseLogging.title: Verbose logging. If checked, log more information at info level, so you can see what's happening in homebridge log without running homebridge in debug mode.
